entry.title: Confidential Script: Emulate soft forks using stateless TEEs
entry.summary: The sender of the email expresses admiration for an ongoing project and mentions their contribution to a fork of Bitcoin's kernel, specifically focusing on the addition of covenant support. The work done includes the implementation of new operation codes: op_ctv, op_csfs, and op_cat. These additions are part of a broader effort to enhance the functionality of Bitcoin through covenants. Furthermore, the sender acknowledges the potential benefits of incorporating simplicity into the project and commits to exploring this possibility in the future. The development efforts are accessible for review and collaboration via a provided GitHub link, which leads to the repository hosting the covenant-enabled Bitcoin kernel fork ([GitHub Repository](https://github.com/stutxo/rust-bitcoinkernel-covenants/tree/covenants_enabled)). This initiative underscores a significant interest in advancing Bitcoin's capabilities by introducing more complex features and functionalities through open-source collaboration.
